text:
I did something similar starting out, and followed a path that might work for him:

• *find early work through freelancing sites like Upwork/iWriter/Zerys.* it pays... poorly, but in the early days, social proof and experience are the biggest limiting factors to getting better work.
• *use your freelance portfolio to reach out to marketing agencies for better paying/more stable work.* a LOT of agencies outsource content to freelancers, and agencies can be great to work with. you deal with one customer, instead of ten, and payment is (relatively) good. I got a lot of work from outreach to local agencies.
• *use your agency portfolio to connect with startups/better agencies/etc.* agencies are normally fairly well connected, and there's a better chance of your content contributing to decent outcomes (i.e. "this article generated $10k in business) - both of which are incredibly useful for levelling-up again and connecting to bigger, better companies
